Text: Two shadows run through the capital at night.

The black-clad forms come to stop on a roof, wary of
something behind them.

They look to have been in quite a hurry. The sound
of their ragged breathing fills the air.
But then...

With no forewarning whatsoever, the chest of one man
is suddenly run through.
A-Ahh...Agah...!

An ebony blade is drawn back out, and the man
collapses with a gurgle and spray of blood.

The remaining man spins around in a panic as a lone
figure emerges from the darkness.
The figure is dressed in a long, pitch-black coat.
Did I keep you waiting...?

His voice is low, like rumblings from deep
in the earth.
Eep...
The man draws back with a gasp.
Why so scared?
Oh, did you maybe think you could escape?
Urk...!
Excellently done.
*End movie

The next morning, a pitiful corpse was found hanging
on a main thoroughfare of the capital. On its stomach
were words scrawled in blood:
THE PATH OF FOOLS

The face of the dead man was twisted with fear and
agony.
Well, I'm glad you're safe...

So the murderers weren't the Shadow Garden, but
another group that had assumed their name?
That's what Shadow said.

Shadow, huh? We're still none the wiser as to who
they are.
Iris lowers her eyes momentarily in thought.

...I also encountered a member of the Shadow Garden
during the recent terrorist attacks.
And she said her name was Alpha, right?
Iris?
I-It's nothing.

Based on other reports, it's clear this Shadow Garden
organization has extremely high combat abilities.

Unfortunately, that's pretty much the extent of what
we know about them. Everything else is a mystery,
including what it is they seek to accomplish.

Well, Shadow did battle with the Cult of Diablos.
Perhaps they're targeting the Cult?

I suppose that is the only lead we have... Perhaps
deciphering the artifact will tell us more.

I had thought the Cult nothing more than a religious
group who worship Diablos, but it seems there is
more to them than meets the eye.
You mean the arson?

There is that...but the truth is, the Crimson Order's
draft budget was rejected. It appears I'll be funding
our operations myself for the time being.
Alexia frowns.

So there are cultists not only within the Order, but
among the civil officials as well?

I'm not sure. It could be a member of the Cult or
simply someone coerced with money...

I forced the founding of the Order through, so I'm
afraid I can't broach the matter too strongly.
If it's funds you need, then I shall help.

Your well wishes are enough. You know how few of us
there are in Crimson Order, yes?
Iris smiles ruefully.
Eight.

Yes, there's only eight of us. With my assets alone,
I could keep us in operation for the next ten years,
easily.
But that would also mean you can't expand the Order.

Bolstering our ranks wouldn't help much now. Not when
we can't even tell friend from foe.
Iris, um...

Alexia looks up at her sister, struggling to find
the words.
Iris... You must not fight Shadow.
There you go again, Alexia...

It's only because you don't know Shadow that you
can speak like that.

Surely you saw that blast that lit the capital that
night!

Yes, and we concluded that it was an artifact run
amok.
No! I swear I saw Shadow unleash it!
No human is capable of producing that much force.

Your memories were muddled after several days in
confinement, and you may have been fed some
substance that made you hallucinate.

But I don't believe you would ever lie. You were
merely a little exhausted.
Iris!

Furthermore, even if this man Shadow truly did
unleash such magic, avoiding him is not an option.
If I did, who would protect this kingdom?

So who is your enemy, the Shadow Garden or the Cult
of Diablos?
Both.
I cannot let anyone do as they please with this land.

Meanwhile, in the ruins on the outskirts of
the royal capital...
We lost contact with the puppet and the other two...
Hehe... So the slashers got themselves slashed.
Whatever shall we do, Sir Gaunt?
...That is of no importance. We know where it is now.
Recovering it is our top priority.
